Title: Band director Sentence 1: Steve really loved band in college. Sentence 2: He played the French horn and wanted to be a band director. Sentence 3: He studied very hard for four years. Sentence 4: But at the end, he realized that he had to stand in front of people. Sentence 5: As he wasn't a social person, his degree was now useless.

Title: The failed song. Sentence 1: Finally he decided to put more effort into the song. Sentence 2: He didn't have much time, so he churned one out quickly. Sentence 3: He shared it all over the place but no one liked it. Sentence 4: Josh was a musician trying to write a new song. Sentence 5: He learned that hard work was the only way to make a good song.

Title: First Tour Sentence 1: Tom joined the army reserves. Sentence 2: He was sent to Iraq on his first tour. Sentence 3: There he saw a bit of action before the accident. Sentence 4: Tom didn't make it out. Sentence 5: His convoy was hit by a roadside bomb.

Title: The Laptop Sentence 1: Ursula was hard at work. Sentence 2: She needed to finish her term paper on her laptop. Sentence 3: SHe typed away all evening. Sentence 4: Just as she hit send, her internet went out! Sentence 5: Finally, she was ready to submit it.

Title: Marissa Goes to the Fair Sentence 1: Marissa really wanted to go to the state fair. Sentence 2: Marissa's parents brought her to the fair. Sentence 3: She spent all weekend cleaning her room. Sentence 4: Marissa's parents said she had to clean her room to go. Sentence 5: Marissa had a great time at the fair.

Title: A Life Lesson Sentence 1: His dad tells him it's too late, he says no. Sentence 2: Ben wants to go to a party. Sentence 3: Ben sneaks out of the house. Sentence 4: Ben sees car lights behind him and hears screeching tires. Sentence 5: Ben dives out of the way, he goes back home.

Title: Accidental Overcharge Sentence 1: Tom went shopping at the mall. Sentence 2: They had him go in and fixed it for him. Sentence 3: He noticed one store had charged him too much. Sentence 4: He called them up and told them the problem. Sentence 5: When he got home he checked his bank account.

Title: Talk to You Later Sentence 1: Megan called her brother on his birthday. Sentence 2: Megan's phone lost it's connection. Sentence 3: She sang his favorite birthday song. Sentence 4: Her brother asked her to sing a song. Sentence 5: They talked later.

Title: Not as Planned Sentence 1: I planned to be productive after finishing my class. Sentence 2: In addition, I had several late payments on bills. Sentence 3: I've became extremely lazy. Sentence 4: I wasn't able to sign up for classes since the deadline passed. Sentence 5: When summer started, I've slept for a few days.

Title: That Kind of Parent Sentence 1: Sue practiced with her small toddler daily. Sentence 2: She was grooming her to do the Gangnam Style dance. Sentence 3: Her toddler finally nailed it! Sentence 4: Five other kids did the same Gangnam Style dance before her. Sentence 5: Sue enrolled her into a local talent show, certain she'd win.

Title: The Beach. Sentence 1: Today I went to the beach. Sentence 2: I walked along the beach. Sentence 3: As I walked, I found seashells. Sentence 4: I found seashells of all shapes and sizes. Sentence 5: I put the seashells in a bucket.

Title: Math test Sentence 1: Tim has a math test. Sentence 2: He has not studied. Sentence 3: He decided to go out instead. Sentence 4: He did terrible on his test. Sentence 5: When he got to school, he didn't know how to answer his problems.

Title: Infertility Sentence 1: When she met Dan and wanted kids with him right away. Sentence 2: Elaine always wanted to give birth and be a mother. Sentence 3: Dan was willing but his body wasn't. Sentence 4: Faced with infertility, Elaine could only rely on adoption. Sentence 5: They signed up and waited five years before they finally had a kid.

Title: Going to the movies. Sentence 1: Austin wanted to watch Suicide Squad at the movie theater. Sentence 2: They all went together to see the movie as a family. Sentence 3: Austin's mom said yes they could go. Sentence 4: Austin's parents had a lot to do that day, but they hurried up. Sentence 5: He asked his mother if she would take him to see the movie.

Title: Toothy smile Sentence 1: Marianne was beautiful but had a crooked tooth when she smiled. Sentence 2: In fact she hid her teeth with all her might. Sentence 3: For many years she didn't want to smile. Sentence 4: She went to the dentist and he put wires in her mouth. Sentence 5: When the wire came out, she grinned so much, her teeth gleamed.

Title: Diet Coke Sentence 1: My wife loves to drink diet coke and so do I. Sentence 2: When I woke up this morning there was one diet coke in the fridge. Sentence 3: I knew even then that there would be bad consequences for doing this. Sentence 4: I then took the Diet Coke, it was so cold and delicious as I drank it. Sentence 5: I stood at the fridge for a long time, thinking about taking it.

Title: X-Rays Sentence 1: Tim was an active young boy. Sentence 2: Tim was playing football with his friends. Sentence 3: Tim hurt his hand. Sentence 4: Tim was happy to learn he did not break his hand. Sentence 5: Tim went to the hospital and had x-rays taken.

Title: A Snowman Sentence 1: A mom and her daughter Lucy played with Play-Doh. Sentence 2: They build a snowman. Sentence 3: Lucy took snowman into the window. Sentence 4: The snowman fell apart. Sentence 5: Lucy cried.

Title: Clubroom Sentence 1: I use our building clubroom often. Sentence 2: I read for an hour down there. Sentence 3: He had changed his mind. Sentence 4: Last night I saw him spending time there. Sentence 5: My 99 year old friend George says he does not like going there.

Title: Solar System Sentence 1: Tom entered into the school science fair. Sentence 2: He asked his father for advice on his project. Sentence 3: Together, they built one out of paper and glue. Sentence 4: His father suggested that he make a model of the solar system. Sentence 5: They presented it together at the fair, proud of their hard work.

Title: The lost money Sentence 1: One day Jeff was walking in the woods. Sentence 2: He was going to watch for birds. Sentence 3: He had found 5 one hundred dollar bills. Sentence 4: Jeff reached down. Sentence 5: He stumbled upon something green on the forest floor.
